ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to analyze primary documents much more in-depth and the history of public health. It was enjoyable to learn how we got where we are at as a country from a medical perspective.

- Analyzing historical medical documents
- Understanding how history factors into today's health practices.

In this course, I learned a lot about how medicine and its practice has progressed throughout American history which was very interesting because it was a very niche history course introduction. I learned more about how the views on medicine and the differences in the practitioner-patient relationships have changed over time.
Learned about the history of medicine in America.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Facilitating discussions with peers and making outside connections. 
Weakness: I felt as if the course was repetitive, at times every student would answer the question with the same answer but in a different format. I also wished the professor would have taught more, for example, slide shows.

Strengths: interesting readings, good professor, good topics
Weakness: Even as a seminar, I think it's too discussion based.
The strengths of this course are the multiple the discussions that we had that helped us prepare for the in class talks.
Absolutely loved the reading. I also liked the paper topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Professor Tannenbaum leads a well organized class that is intellectually stimulating and helps facilitate learning well.
I would recommend this course to anyone who has even a slight interest in public health, the course work is manageable and Professor Tannenbaum is super understanding.
Yes. Professor Tannenbaum is great! The readings are interesting as well.
Yes definitely because it provided me an introduction to the major that I did not know about before!
Yes, most interesting course Ive ever taken.
